Column Comment.0: FIRST ZONE DEFINITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for amineral zone definitionthat is created and maintained by a regulatory or other agency as one of a set ofstandards. May also be an ad hoc definition for the land zone that is created by anowner or administrator. In the most common usage, this indicates the value of thezone definition that is old.
Column Comment.1: SECOND ZONE DEFINITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for amineral zonedefinition that is created and maintained by a regulatory or other agency as one of aset of standards. May also be an ad hoc definition for the land zone that is created byan owner or administrator. In the most common use case, this indicates the value ofthe zone definition that is new.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DESCRIPTION: textual description of the mineral zone definition
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.8: RESPONSIBLE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: The unique identifier for the businessassociate who is responsible for replacing this old zone definition, usually aregulatory agency, although other organizations may also create and replace zonedefinitions as they require.
Column Comment.9: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.10: ZONE DEFINITION CROSS REFERENCE REASON: Describes the reason whyspatial zone definitions have been cross referenced. The most common (but not theonly) reason is a replacement of a zone definition with a new one by a regulatoryagency.
Column Comment.11: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.13: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.15: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
